title: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException & java.nio.channels.UnsupportedAddressTypeException
body:
### Steps to Reproduce (Bug)
1. Use Version v21.10.0 in Docker
2. Use Ethereum Classic Chain
3. Full Sync

**Actual behavior:**

````
besu_1           | 2021-11-12 19:11:02.631+00:00 | nioEventLoopGroup-3-2 | ERROR | Subscribers | Error in callback:
besu_1           | java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Comparison method violates its general contract!
`````

&
`````
besu_1           | 2021-11-12 19:16:15.445+00:00 | vert.x-eventloop-thread-4 | WARN  | PeerDiscoveryAgent | Sending to peer DiscoveryPeer{status=bonding, enode=enode://bd170ae95e175a4f50211156a00f7173844841433d7baa1aa950441fd41e6a94ab8724fce8aebc67021b897d4984d5e9a7ca77730aa1ea98e128f1edc816690a@[2a01:4f8:1c17:c48f::1]:30303, firstDiscovered=1636744549062, lastContacted=0, lastSeen=0} failed, packet: 0x0cd6c81cf8c5b89bee76283579139bbafa75adb85bab1d07445904dfde0c247bd89afc0f031b3e0e2aa245fc9d9fa4f18ea389f43a299dced07e604ca4ea89423d62a55c897806f6587048c1179dab25c7ce364e6b876d0f28fe03ea71cc32a90101eb05cb847f00000182765f82765fd7902a0104f81c17c48f000000000000000182765f82765f84618ebdbb56

besu_1           |      at io.vertx.core.impl.EventLoopContext.lambda$executeAsync$0(EventLoopContext.java:38)

`````

**Frequency:** often, but does not crash besu

### Versions (Add all that apply)
* Docker Version:  Tag:v21.10.0

### Additional Information

Full log; https://txt.mariomichel.com/?36efa66e1c3ef09c#68nd9nC9BD8wnrCRRYkGzPafStkihTZqpJzyQSQEhWX1
Update: Also occur in v21.10.2 release

My suspicion is that we get the first exception when we [sort the stream of Peers](https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/blob/2abc7074bb54ed0c92ad143dfc96166c1f6ac5a4/ethereum/eth/src/main/java/org/hyperledger/besu/ethereum/eth/sync/BlockPropagationManager.java#L260) and we use volatile fields for that. I suspect that one of the fields that was used might got changed in the middle of the sort and therefore caused the exception.

@MrMarioMichel I think the `java.nio.channels.UnsupportedAddressTypeException` should be fixed in latest besu - see https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/pull/2970

Are you still getting the IllegalArgumentException?
@MrMarioMichel if you have any extra info to add that would be useful. Also are you still on besu 21.10.0?
I think it's solved in the recent releases. Never saw that error again after upgrading.
